abstract: The sale comes as the conglomerate prepares to spin off its education division to focus on its business information unit.
snippet: The sale comes as the conglomerate prepares to spin off its education division to focus on its business information unit.
lead_paragraph: The McGraw-Hill Companies said on Monday that it had agreed to sell its broadcasting group to E.W. Scripps for $212 million in cash, the latest effort by the conglomerate to reshape itself.

headline.main: McGraw-Hill to Sell Broadcasting Unit to Scripps for $212 Million
